blog.name: iceandfirecon
blog.title: Ice & Fire Con
blog.description: Ice & Fire Con is an A Song of Ice and Fire/Game of Thrones convention for fans, by fans which will take place April 25-28, 2019. Tickets on sale now!

summary: REMINDER: Sign ups are open for all of our events that require pre-convention sign up. Please check out the following links....
body:
REMINDER: Sign ups are open for all of our events that require pre-convention sign up. Please check out the following links. Faceless Man signups are open through 4/5 or until the game is full. Board game tournament, performance contest, and Tourney of Champions sign ups are open through the 21st, or until they fill up.

Board game tournament (sign ups open until 4/21 or until full; tournament begins at 5 PM Friday 4/26, will break for the musical, and resume later that night): http://www.iceandfirecon.com/events/board-game-tournament/

Faceless Man (sign ups open until 4/5 or until full; game begins at 9 PM Thursday 4/25): http://www.iceandfirecon.com/events/faceless-man/

Performance contest (sign ups are open until 4/21 or until full; contest will kick off around 5 PM - just after the costume parade - on Saturday 4/27): http://www.iceandfirecon.com/…/costume-parade-performance-…/

Tourney of Champions (sign ups are open until 4/21 or until full; the Tourney is scheduled for 2 PM Saturday 4/27): http://www.iceandfirecon.com/events/tourney-of-champions/

blog.name: ao3feed-jonrya
blog.title: AO3feed-Jonrya
blog.description: An automated feed for Jon x Arya fics posted on AO3.

title: Lost in Paradise
description:
by Marcus_Crassus

Age of Sail AU, basically Blue Lagoon with Starklings.

Jon, Arya and Sansa get shipwrecked on a deserted island in the south Pacific, and spend years learning to survive and thrive. Only as they all get into puberty and start dealing with all the hormones and emotions that comes with that….

I enjoy playing with the idea that all 3 have a bit of a thing for each other (the primary pairings are Jon/Arya and Jon/Sansa, but there will be some Arya/Sansa), but all 3 struggle with knowing its supposed to be wrong, but they don’t have any other outlet for what they’re going through.

Definitely going to be on the more sweet and romantic side, but hopefully with some delicious smut in there once we get going. Probably some angst as well, because reasons.

Words: 712, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Underage
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark, Sansa Stark
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Sansa Stark, Jon Snow/Arya Stark/Sansa Stark
  • Additional Tags: First Time, shipwrecked, innocent teenagers, They’re all thirsty for each other, But they all think its weird

summary: In order to get in shape for my new Game of Thrones music video (out today!!) ⚔️ I made sacrifices and worked hard at the gym....
caption: In order to get in shape for my new Game of Thrones music video (out today!!) ⚔️ I made sacrifices and worked hard at the gym. But one thing I definitely did NOT do was a fad diet. Nor did I put my body through an unsustainable routine. I’m telling you this because I have noticed more and more Instagramers pushing diets and products to get “fast results”, meanwhile they’re getting paid to tell you this and it’s not clear if they actually follow the program they’re promoting. We live in a world where we see what we want, and we want it NOW. But when it comes to your fitness, it’s not that simple (unfortunate, but true!) Sometimes social media can seem plastic and body-obsessed, and you might be thinking that I’m just “part of the problem” - but I have talked openly about the time and sacrifice it takes to reach my fitness goals. 🏋🏻‍♂️ The only “product” I’ll promote is hard work, determination, and a lot of self care. Treat your body with lots of love and don’t ask it to do something that feels unhealthy or extreme. 💖 And while you’re at it.. check out my music video for Game of Thrones because I froze my butt off on a snowy mountain for your enjoyment (ok, that might have been a little extreme!!) 🎻😜

blog.name: gendrie
blog.title: fierce and terrible and hers
blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

summary: If she were highborn, command would come naturally to her, and deference to them. Brienne wondered whether Willow might be more...
body:
If she were highborn, command would come naturally to her, and deference to them. Brienne wondered whether Willow might be more than she appeared.
Brown hair, brown eyes, skinny … could it be? Arya Stark’s hair was brown, she recalled, but Brienne was not sure of the color of her eyes. Brown and brown, was that it? Could it be that she did not die at Saltpans after all?

My lord father is bringing me a Stark girl. Lord Eddard’s daughter, Arya. You remember little Arya, don’t you?“
Arya Underfoot, he almost said. Arya Horseface. Robb’s younger sister, brown-haired, long-faced, skinny as a stick, always dirty.
"I remember her. Arya.”
“She shall be the Lady of Winterfell, and me her lord.”

Arya. Jon straightened. It had to be her. […] She looked enough like Arya to give him pause, but only for a moment. A tall, skinny, coltish girl, all legs and elbows, her brown hair was woven in a thick braid and bound about with strips of leather. She had a long face, a pointy chin, small ears. 

three bastards all rising up through the ranks of society - ramsay is legitimized and made lord of winterfell. jon becomes lord commander of the wall. gendry is a knighted at the hollow hill. 

- and each has a connection to arya. arya served roose during her time in harrenhal but she narrowly escaped their clutches. the boltons then force jeyne poole to pretend she’s arya and marry ramsay so they can claim the north with “arya” as lady of winterfell 

jon and arya were the closest among the stark children. he believes her to be dead until receiving news of arya’s upcoming marriage to the boltons. melisandre tells jon arya is on her way to him on the wall but it turns out to be alys karstark. she resembles arya too and smiles like her in a way that almost breaks jons heart. alys is a lady but she - unconventionally - marries a wildling. 

gendry and arya formed a close bond while traveling through the riverlands together. willow is running the crossroads where gendry lives now. she has a similar temperament and appearance as arya (+ the same age) brienne wonders if the girl could actually be arya and hyle says she will most likely marry gendry who is deeply mourning the loss of the real arya. 

so we have 3 bastards with 3 arya’s and multiple marriage references. thats a pattern.

reblog.comment:
If she were highborn, command would come naturally to her, and deference to them. Brienne wondered whether Willow might be more than she appeared.
Brown hair, brown eyes, skinny … could it be? Arya Stark’s hair was brown, she recalled, but Brienne was not sure of the color of her eyes. Brown and brown, was that it? Could it be that she did not die at Saltpans after all?

My lord father is bringing me a Stark girl. Lord Eddard’s daughter, Arya. You remember little Arya, don’t you?“
Arya Underfoot, he almost said. Arya Horseface. Robb’s younger sister, brown-haired, long-faced, skinny as a stick, always dirty.
"I remember her. Arya.”
“She shall be the Lady of Winterfell, and me her lord.”

Arya. Jon straightened. It had to be her. […] She looked enough like Arya to give him pause, but only for a moment. A tall, skinny, coltish girl, all legs and elbows, her brown hair was woven in a thick braid and bound about with strips of leather. She had a long face, a pointy chin, small ears.

- and each has a connection to arya. arya served roose during her time in harrenhal but she narrowly escaped their clutches. the boltons then force jeyne poole to pretend she’s arya and marry ramsay so they can claim the north with “arya” as lady of winterfell

so we have 3 bastards with 3 arya’s and multiple marriage references. thats a pattern.

blog.title: A Room of My Own
blog.description: I love pretty people, fandom (my currents are GoT, Avengers, Harry Potter, and whatever else catches my fancy), and fashion. And traveling to Japan. I love Japan so much.

summary: If they don’t have Ghost fighting alongside Jon Snow in the Battle for the Dawn I’m going to be so pissed off. I don’t care if...
body: If they don’t have Ghost fighting alongside Jon Snow in the Battle for the Dawn I’m going to be so pissed off. I don’t care if he may be able to ride a dragon, I want my damn direwolf back.

blog.name: jonerystogether
blog.title: Let It Be Fear
blog.description: 21 | English | life basically revolves around the jonerys | #jonerystrash till the day I die

body:
When the Party’s Over

Disclaimer: this is my interpretation of the lyrics of ‘when the party’s over’ by Billie Eilish. It is more than likely not what the song is about but i got inspired to write it like this when i heard it.

Don’t you know i’m no good for you 

I’ve learned to lose you can’t afford to

Tore my shirt to stop you bleeding

But nothing ever stops you leaving

The quiet of the house was something she doesn’t think she will ever get used to. Once a place filled with light and laughter is now blanketed in darkness and despair. The oasis she loved to live in, now an abyss of negative emotions she would rather live without.

Placing her keys in the bowl by the door and hanging her coat on the hook after a party was something that was not new to her. But doing it in the dark, all alone is not something she was accustomed to. The once annoying act of tripping over shoes left in the doorway is a burden she wishes she could bring back. Things that were once so big, and now so very absent, she wishes for nothing more than to have them return to her.

No TV in the background. No sound of running water from the bathroom. The only water running was the tears leaving her eyes and rolling down her cheeks. Turning on the lights and expecting his figure to be slumped asleep on the sofa, but only the dip in the cushions was what remained. Walking to the bedroom and wanting to see a trail of his clothes on the floor but wanting all she liked didn’t make it come true.

Opening the wardrobe, she tossed her boots on top of the pile of shoes that have been left unorganised since she no longer shared the space. His things had been put into boxes and moved into the loft. The lack of his shirts and jumpers leaving a gaping hole in the right side of the wardrobe much like the hole left within her heart. Not even their dog was here anymore. Having to now live with his relatives due to her not being able to care for him as much as he used to. She doesn’t think she will be able to care for herself either.

She was never good enough for him, she knew that, but he didn’t care. A lost girl, found by a boy that was willing to help mend her from her messy past, and she couldn’t even save him.

Sitting on the bed she squinted at the glare of her phone screen, staring at the picture that was before her. She was on his back, he was laughing like she had never seen anyone laugh before. A rolling field of green behind them. But now only rolling thunder and rain was her reality. The sun could shine, and the birds could sing, but that will never settle the storm of emotions that will live within her for as long as she was on this earth without him.

A vibration in her hand brought her out of her reverie. A message, but not from him, from her friend. Her best friend asking if she was okay. She replied yes, but she thought no, she would never be okay again. Is this what her life would become, an endless cycle of lies to quell the worry of others? Maybe that was for the best.

A screech from outside startled her. A car turning the corner too fast. Much like that day. The day he was taken from her, too fast.

-

Blue skies for miles and warm air swirled through the open widow next to her. Music from the radio was filling the car whilst they drove out of the city towards the coast.

It was a surprise weekend away she had gifted him a few weeks before his birthday. He was opposed to attention, even when it came to birthdays, so she thought surprising him before the day would make up for it. Celebrating thirty years on earth is a big deal she kept telling him, but he just laughed and returned back to whatever book he was lost reading this time. She went and booked it anyway.

He suspected something was up when she was out of bed earlier than normal, lunch was in Tupperware boxes on the kitchen side and she was smiling like a lunatic when he finally peeled himself out of the sheets of their bed.

She insisted on driving, she knew he knew what was happening, but she was grateful he played along. Out of the city the traffic had thinned out. They could finally make their way to the peaceful seaside cabin for a weekend of rest and relaxation that they both knew they needed. But it would never be.

The happiness lasted about fifteen minutes after getting out of the city. Fifteen short minutes before she heard the screech. A car going too fast down the country lane spun into them. The back of the car hitting the front of theirs. That’s all she could remember before waking up in hospital later that day.

They had gotten him to the hospital, all with the hope that they could remove the glass from his chest and close his skull back up. The hope was short lived. He had lost too much blood and his body shutdown from the shock of the trauma. She wished she hadn’t been so lucky.

-

She looked at her phone again, but this time at the numbers across the screen. Four zeros looking back at her, that soon turned into eight as the tears resurfaced and blurred her vision.

She stood and walked back through to the kitchen towards the fridge. She hadn’t eaten much in the last three weeks. She didn’t feel like filling herself up when her life would never be whole again. So, the only items in her fridge were bottles of alcohol and sad looking vegetables that were bought for her to encourage her to eat. She preferred the alcohol.

She took out the champagne that she was saving for this occasion. She was saving it for when they got back. But there was no they anymore, just she.

Popping the cork and letting the foam spill onto the tiled floor, she grabbed her phone off the counter and rang the number.

It rang and rang until she heard him. It was him but not who she wanted. A robotic version talking to her letting her know he will get back to her when he could. But that was never going to happen. He would never be able to get back to her. Not in this life anyway.

She chugged the champagne as one that was meant for two, while she listened to his voice. The beep sounded and now it was her turn to talk.

“Happy Birthday, Jon” she choked out. She sank to her knees and leant against one of the kitchen cabinets and sobbed into the phone. “I told you I would ring you when the party was over”. She talked about the celebration of what would have been his thirtieth year on this earth until his answer phone was so full of stories, she thought he might hear one of them from the little flat they used to call home.

It rang and rang until she heard him. It was him but not who she wanted. A robotic version talking to her letting her know he will get back to her when he could. But that was never going to happen. He would never be able to get back to her. Not in this life anyway.

She chugged the champagne as one that was meant for two, while she listened to his voice. The beep sounded and now it was her turn to talk.

“Happy Birthday, Jon” she choked out. She sank to her knees and leant against one of the kitchen cabinets and sobbed into the phone. “I told you I would ring you when the party was over”. She talked about the celebration of what would have been his thirtieth year on this earth until his answer phone was so full of stories, she thought he might hear one of them from the little flat they used to call home.
trail.content:
When the Party’s Over

Disclaimer: this is my interpretation of the lyrics of ‘when the party’s over’ by Billie Eilish. It is more than likely not what the song is about but i got inspired to write it like this when i heard it.

Don’t you know i’m no good for you 

I’ve learned to lose you can’t afford to

Tore my shirt to stop you bleeding

But nothing ever stops you leaving

The quiet of the house was something she doesn’t think she will ever get used to. Once a place filled with light and laughter is now blanketed in darkness and despair. The oasis she loved to live in, now an abyss of negative emotions she would rather live without.

Placing her keys in the bowl by the door and hanging her coat on the hook after a party was something that was not new to her. But doing it in the dark, all alone is not something she was accustomed to. The once annoying act of tripping over shoes left in the doorway is a burden she wishes she could bring back. Things that were once so big, and now so very absent, she wishes for nothing more than to have them return to her.

No TV in the background. No sound of running water from the bathroom. The only water running was the tears leaving her eyes and rolling down her cheeks. Turning on the lights and expecting his figure to be slumped asleep on the sofa, but only the dip in the cushions was what remained. Walking to the bedroom and wanting to see a trail of his clothes on the floor but wanting all she liked didn’t make it come true.

Opening the wardrobe, she tossed her boots on top of the pile of shoes that have been left unorganised since she no longer shared the space. His things had been put into boxes and moved into the loft. The lack of his shirts and jumpers leaving a gaping hole in the right side of the wardrobe much like the hole left within her heart. Not even their dog was here anymore. Having to now live with his relatives due to her not being able to care for him as much as he used to. She doesn’t think she will be able to care for herself either.

She was never good enough for him, she knew that, but he didn’t care. A lost girl, found by a boy that was willing to help mend her from her messy past, and she couldn’t even save him.

Sitting on the bed she squinted at the glare of her phone screen, staring at the picture that was before her. She was on his back, he was laughing like she had never seen anyone laugh before. A rolling field of green behind them. But now only rolling thunder and rain was her reality. The sun could shine, and the birds could sing, but that will never settle the storm of emotions that will live within her for as long as she was on this earth without him.

A vibration in her hand brought her out of her reverie. A message, but not from him, from her friend. Her best friend asking if she was okay. She replied yes, but she thought no, she would never be okay again. Is this what her life would become, an endless cycle of lies to quell the worry of others? Maybe that was for the best.

A screech from outside startled her. A car turning the corner too fast. Much like that day. The day he was taken from her, too fast.

-

Blue skies for miles and warm air swirled through the open widow next to her. Music from the radio was filling the car whilst they drove out of the city towards the coast.

It was a surprise weekend away she had gifted him a few weeks before his birthday. He was opposed to attention, even when it came to birthdays, so she thought surprising him before the day would make up for it. Celebrating thirty years on earth is a big deal she kept telling him, but he just laughed and returned back to whatever book he was lost reading this time. She went and booked it anyway.

He suspected something was up when she was out of bed earlier than normal, lunch was in Tupperware boxes on the kitchen side and she was smiling like a lunatic when he finally peeled himself out of the sheets of their bed.

She insisted on driving, she knew he knew what was happening, but she was grateful he played along. Out of the city the traffic had thinned out. They could finally make their way to the peaceful seaside cabin for a weekend of rest and relaxation that they both knew they needed. But it would never be.

The happiness lasted about fifteen minutes after getting out of the city. Fifteen short minutes before she heard the screech. A car going too fast down the country lane spun into them. The back of the car hitting the front of theirs. That’s all she could remember before waking up in hospital later that day.

They had gotten him to the hospital, all with the hope that they could remove the glass from his chest and close his skull back up. The hope was short lived. He had lost too much blood and his body shutdown from the shock of the trauma. She wished she hadn’t been so lucky.

-

She looked at her phone again, but this time at the numbers across the screen. Four zeros looking back at her, that soon turned into eight as the tears resurfaced and blurred her vision.

She stood and walked back through to the kitchen towards the fridge. She hadn’t eaten much in the last three weeks. She didn’t feel like filling herself up when her life would never be whole again. So, the only items in her fridge were bottles of alcohol and sad looking vegetables that were bought for her to encourage her to eat. She preferred the alcohol.

She took out the champagne that she was saving for this occasion. She was saving it for when they got back. But there was no they anymore, just she.

Popping the cork and letting the foam spill onto the tiled floor, she grabbed her phone off the counter and rang the number.

It rang and rang until she heard him. It was him but not who she wanted. A robotic version talking to her letting her know he will get back to her when he could. But that was never going to happen. He would never be able to get back to her. Not in this life anyway.

She chugged the champagne as one that was meant for two, while she listened to his voice. The beep sounded and now it was her turn to talk.

“Happy Birthday, Jon” she choked out. She sank to her knees and leant against one of the kitchen cabinets and sobbed into the phone. “I told you I would ring you when the party was over”. She talked about the celebration of what would have been his thirtieth year on this earth until his answer phone was so full of stories, she thought he might hear one of them from the little flat they used to call home.

blog.name: flibbertigiblet
blog.title: i'm just a low-key stan, man
blog.description:
A cynical romantic who sees parallels, archetypes and tropes in just about everything.
Sometimes I make things and park 'em under the #flibbertigiblet tag. Possibly open to requests so drop me an ask if you've got something in mind.

summary: Queen Naerys and Prince Aemon the Dragonknight, Jonsa edition* Then seek not, sweet, the “If” and “Why” I love you now until I...
caption:
Queen Naerys and Prince Aemon the Dragonknight, Jonsa edition*

Then seek not, sweet, the “If” and “Why”
I love you now until I die.
For I must love because I live
And life in me is what you give.

– Christopher Brennan, Because She Would Ask Me Why I Loved Her

* For a more in-depth examination of this parallel, check out @thelawyerthatwaspromised ‘s excellent meta here.

Also, click on the pic to see the full-sized version. It’s worth seeing it in higher def, I promise.

* Original painting is La Belle Dame Sans Merci by Frank Dicksee

Part of my GoT in Art series.

summary: Gotta love how some people can't stand to see a Sansa post. They hate her so much they don't want her name tagged along with the...
body: Gotta love how some people can’t stand to see a Sansa post. They hate her so much they don’t want her name tagged along with the names of their faves in a non ship post with 0 hate. Calm down the post was meant for a larger audience not just the shippers. You can’t babyproof tumblr. Besides you should try to see the other side of the story. You may learn something and it builds character. Finally it is all just Game of Thrones.
